p: Global existing vegetation types were defined for the period 1982–1996 ( Fig. 2A) and the period 1997–2013 ( Fig. 2B). Changes in the distribution of existing vegetation were found worldwide, except in the polar and desert regions, from the period 1982–1996 to the period 1997–2013 ( Fig. 2C). The largest changes in vegetation types were found in central Africa, eastern China, western America and Australia. The least changes in the vegetation were found in tropical rainforest, tropical and temperate deserts, frigid deciduous coniferous forest and polar frost.
